thread.title: This is how important David Wheeler is to Exeter City

author: David_Byrom
title: This is how important David Wheeler is to Exeter City
text:
This is how important David Wheeler is to Exeter City By David_Byrom | Posted: August 16, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Pinnacle David Wheeler of Exeter City is treated for a knock by Ade Saunderson at Swindon Town This is how important David Wheeler is to Exeter City X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Pictures: Pinnacle Comments (0) 
David Wheeler is a doubt for Exeter City's home game against Lincoln City this weekend after being subjected to a heavy tackle during Saturday's 1-1 draw with Swindon Town. 
Wheeler was last season's top scorer for City and broke the record for the amount of goals scored in consecutive matches - and the stats do not lie over how important he is to the Grecians. 
Since signing for City from Staines four years ago, he has played an impressive 161 league games, missing a comparatively few 36. READ MORE: David Wheeler column: Exeter City winger on Swindon Town, Lincoln City, Brexit and his future plans 
In the games he has played in, he has a record of 59 wins, 45 draws and 57 losses, giving him - and City - win percentage of 36.6 per cent for matches he has played in and a loss percentage of 35.4 per cent. 
However, City's record in league games Wheeler has not played in since joining the Grecians is, as a percentage, worse. 
In games Wheeler has not played in, City have lost 17, drawn seven and won just 12, giving them a win percentage of 33.3 per cent but a much bigger loss percentage of 47.2 per cent. 
This shows how important Wheeler is to City - whilst there is only a three per cent difference in win ratio, the much bigger loss percentage shows how much more difficult to beat City are with Wheeler in the side.
